image.altText: A young Indigenous man in a wheelchair, being wheeled out by an older man through the front of a court building's front door

props.synopsis: A judge has spared a man prison time after he was found to have assaulted two police officers with a spear, before they shot him, during an incident in Darwin's outer suburbs in 2022.

title.children: Man shot by police officers after threatening them with spear avoids prison time

image.altText: A woman in glasses and a grey shirt smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Councillor Amanda Kingdon is warned to stay off the grounds of Katherine Town Council's office building for the next 12 months or be met with criminal charges, amid an escalating dispute.

title.children: Councillor banned from council offices, issued with no-trespass order, in dispute over Facebook post

image.altText: Spencer Porter

props.synopsis: The liquidator of a tiny home business believes the company may have been trading insolvent for almost one year, saying the director had "no real prospect" of supplying the product he sold.

title.children: 'Foolish' business model led to collapse of tiny homes company that owes Australians millions, liquidator says

image.altText: Saline drip

props.synopsis: A shortage of IV fluids will last until at least the end of this year, as health ministers agree to meet weekly on the issue while critical supply constraints remain.

title.children: IV fluid shortage will remain for the rest of 2024, but health ministers urge calm

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds a press conference with New Zealand prime minister Christopher Luxon.

props.synopsis: The Prime Minister says Australia and New Zealand have agreed to disagree over the fraught issue of criminal deportations after sitting down with Christopher Luxon for high level talks today in Canberra.

title.children: Australia and NZ agree to disagree on criminal deportations, Anthony Albanese says

image.altText: CLP leader Lia Finocchiaro and Territory Labor leader Eva Lawler standing side-by-side outside NT Parliament House and smiling.

props.synopsis: Stateline NT sits down with the leaders of the Northern Territory's two major parties in the lead-up to the NT election, for a debate on issues from crime and alcohol policy to their parties' chances at the polls.

title.children: NT political leaders face off over crime, COVID and soaring flight costs ahead of election

image.altText: Paetongtarn Shinawatra stands with her hands in a wai with a microphone flanked by a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Thailand's parliament votes to appoint Pheu Thai party leader Paetongtarn Shinawatra as the country's new prime minister, continuing a family dynasty.

title.children: Youngest Thai prime minister voted in by parliament after previous leader removed

image.altText: A Sydney Swans AFL player is surrounded by teammates after he kicks a goal.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans take a long time to get in gear, but they sweep Essendon away in the second half at Docklands to end the Bombers' finals hopes. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Swans surge ends Bombers season at Docklands

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FT: Sydney beats Essendon by 39 points
HT: Essendon leads Sydney by seven points

image.altText: Evelyn Greenup main pic

props.synopsis: When Michelle's four-year-old niece was murdered in Bowraville, she says the police let her family down. Now, she supports a Senate inquiry's call for the entire country to commemorate victims.

title.children: 'It always takes me back to that day we couldn't find Evelyn': Landmark inquiry reignites heartache for family of murdered children

image.altText: A man scores a try in a rugby league match

props.synopsis: A rainstorm ensured meant the Roosters and Eels played in conditions straight out of the 1980s but the Tricolours rose above the deluge to score a handy win which all but secures a top four berth.

title.children: Rampant Roosters get wet and wild in easy win over Parramatta

image.altText: A middle-aged Sri Lankan woman in glasses speaks into a microphone, with a sign reading 'Sri Lanka'

props.synopsis: A former Sri Lankan deputy high commissioner based in Australia has been ordered to pay more than $500,000 in unpaid wages to a domestic worker, who worked seven days a week for three years, with only two days off.

title.children: This boss paid her worker about 65 cents an hour. Now she is facing the consequences

image.altText: A view from above of a city on the coast with a shipping port

props.synopsis: Haifa lives with the vivid memory of being hit with rockets. It's taking unique steps to keep safe.

title.children: Burrowing underground — the world's largest fortified hospital lying in wait if Hezbollah attacks Israel

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks into a microphone while gesturing with both hands.

props.synopsis: As Kamala Harris pulls ahead of the former president in the polls, an increasing number of Republicans are urging their nominee to change tack or risk losing in November.

title.children: Republicans are warning Donald Trump to dial down the personal attacks. Here's why he's refusing

image.altText: Home and Away actor Orpheus Pledger wears a hoodie and has a neutral expression as he arrives at court

props.synopsis: Former Home and Away star Orpheus Pledger has been sentenced to jail over an assault, with a magistrate telling him society is "fed up" with men attacking women.

title.children: Society is 'fed up' with men attacking women, magistrate says as he sentences actor to jail over assault

image.altText: firefighters holding hoses putting out a house fire

props.synopsis: Steve Nassif pleaded guilty to damaging a $24 million mansion in Sydney's north shore by fire in September 2022.

title.children: Property developer jailed over blaze that destroyed historic $24m Sydney mansion

image.altText: Two men outside a court house.

props.synopsis: Two alleged West Australian gold thieves have walked free with all charges against them dismissed, following a police forensics bungle which a defence lawyer argued would have "undermined public confidence in the justice system".

title.children: Alleged gold thieves walk free, awarded more than $22K in costs as forensics bungle sees trial abandoned

image.altText: AI influencer Margot Monet, pictured in a graphic image.

props.synopsis: As people spend more time online, bonds forged with influencers generated by artificial intelligence are rising. But experts warn the phenomenon could also be fuelling harmful behaviours in the darker corners of the internet.

title.children: Margot Monet's creators hoped she would rake in thousands as an AI influencer. The truth was more frightening

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiles at a freshly groomed labradoodle alongside a woman with grey hair embracing a scruffy one.

props.synopsis: Four weeks after one of Tasmania's largest dog-breeding business shut down, the last of more than 230 labradoodles have been surrendered to the RSPCA.

title.children: 'Single-biggest animal welfare operation in Tasmania's history': Last dogs removed from labradoodle breeder rehomed

image.altText: A sad woman in a pink dress

props.synopsis: Alannah Lewis-Stafford hasn't lived in her wreckage of a home for two years, but her water company has continued to send her bills.

title.children: Alannah's home was destroyed, but her water company refused to stop charging her

image.altText: A closeup of Sarah Carter's face, she is smiling.

props.synopsis: Victorian councillor and former Maribyrnong mayor Sarah Carter has been remembered by family and friends "fearlessly intelligent" and a "tireless advocate".

title.children: Former Maribyrnong mayor remembered as voice of community, role model

image.altText: A black and white furry panda rests her head on a rock

props.synopsis: The twins are the first locally born pandas in Hong Kong, with the pregnancy only being confirmed on Sunday.

title.children: Twin panda babies born in Hong Kong to oldest first-time mum

image.altText: Jasveen Sangha wearing a GUCCI t-shirt.

props.synopsis: A woman dubbed the "Ketamine Queen" by authorities is one of five people charged in relation to Matthew Perry's overdose death. Here's what what we know about Jasveen Sangha.

title.children: Who is the accused 'Ketamine Queen' charged over Matthew Perry's overdose death?

image.altText: Three soldiers wearing Ukranian military gear pose with guns next to vehicle

props.synopsis: "General Syrskyi reported the successful liberation of the city of Sudzha from Russian forces," President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

title.children: Ukraine says they have full control of Russian town Sudzha as advance continues

image.altText: A silhouette of a firefighter spraying in the brush, the air around them orange.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese warns of the possibility that fires raging in Türkiye might reach ANZAC graves in Gallipoli.

title.children: 'Sacred ground' in ANZAC Cove under threat as fires rage across Türkiye, PM says

image.altText: A composite image of six books for young readers, including illustrated picture books, and the gold Book of the Year sticker.

props.synopsis: The winners of the Children's Book Council of Australia's 2024 Book of the Year Awards have been announced, including debut author Karen Comer and author of 19 books Tristan Bancks.

title.children: 'It's never been so difficult to get a book into kids' hands': The book prize reaching young people

image.altText: A young Indigenous man in a wheelchair, being wheeled out by an older man through the front of a court building's front door

props.synopsis: A judge has spared a man prison time after he was found to have assaulted two police officers with a spear, before they shot him, during an incident in Darwin's outer suburbs in 2022.

title.children: Man shot by police officers after threatening them with spear avoids prison time

image.altText: A woman in a white swimming costume with a sash and wearing a visor

props.synopsis: Tayla Brailey, 30, was released on bail less than a fortnight ago, after being initially charged for sexually abusing a 17-year-old boy at her school.

title.children: Sydney schoolteacher charged with abusing second student

image.altText: Callum Cameron

props.synopsis: A man who stabbed his mother dozens of times in their Perth home, with some of the attack taking place in front of paramedics, is found guilty of her murder.

title.children: Angry, intoxicated Perth man who stabbed his mother 60 times found guilty of her 'brutal' murder

image.altText: A black and white photo of two workers dumping out strawberries.

props.synopsis: Skip bins full of strawberries have been dumped or fed to cattle after four days of heavy downpours in south-east Queensland.

title.children: Millions of dollars worth of strawberries dumped after days of rain

image.altText: A woman in a sparkling leotard sings and looks on.

props.synopsis: Pop megastar Taylor Swift returns to the stage in London for her first public performances since three shows in Vienna were cancelled after authorities uncovered a terrorist plot to "kill as many people as possible" at them.

title.children: 'I'm not worried at all': Fans unfazed by foiled terror plot as Taylor Swift resumes touring

image.altText: "I QUIT" written on a yellow post-it note sitting on a keyboard

props.synopsis: You are working long hours, being repeatedly rostered to work weekends and are increasingly anxious and unhappy in your job. You decide to quit, but your boss won't let you. But can an employer actually reject a resignation?

title.children: Can your boss stop you from resigning if you want to quit your job?

image.altText: a man aged 38 with three young children

props.synopsis: Dale Pantic's family are still searching for answers about how their missing father died as his killer Sam Gordon Blake is sentenced over his death following an 11th-hour guilty plea to manslaughter.

title.children: Father of five's body missing as killer gets nine years for manslaughter
